content.description:
Start on Biddles Steel, but immediately go left to the diagonal jug to transition into Biddles Platinum.

The way I did it involved some strange footwork; ymmv
content.location: Left hand on the diagonal slopey crimp, right hand on the diagonal undercling as is the start for Biddles Platinum

content.description: Start on the uphill side of the rock next to the approach trail and traverse right into the ending of Biddles Platinum. Topping out in the Scoop is an awkward V5 variation.
content.location: If your walking uphill from the main trail, you should see the chalked holds there are many places you can start but a side pull hueco jug is the norm.

content.description: Start at the bottom of the tower near the trail. Traverse right, round the corner and go up the hueco. Crux is the corner. Pumpy, so Â find find ways to conserve energy.
content.protection: Couple pads closer to the corner where you're more likely to lose it.
content.location: As you approach the tower the start is pretty much directly in front of you at the base of the tower.

content.description: Sit start on Biddles Platinum, but at the the diagonal jug traverse right into the V5 stand start over the rocks.
content.location: The crack, and the rightmost line on the boulder.

content.description: Start with left hand on a slopey one-pad edge and right hand low down on the arete. Make a move to a decent pinch, then bump again to a good pocket. Pass a couple of crimps before making a long move to the lip and a tall (but fun) topout on knobs.
content.protection: It's helpful to have a couple pads on this one.
content.location: Farthest right route on the uphill side of Biddles Tower.

climbs.name: Biddles Platinum
climbs.fa: Chris Summit (sit start) Clay Bretweiser (Stand start)

content.description: Sit start and climb the fist crack up to the top. Hand jams are not necessary if you get creative! Mid stand start is V4, high stand start is V3. Great find Clay!
content.location: Left side of the back side. The fist crack.
